grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 据銃【キョジュウ】mounting a gun (i.e. holding the stock against one's shoulder), gun mount
拮据【キッキョ】diligence, assiduity, pinching, hard toil
kun reading compounds: 据える【すえる】to place (in position), to fix, to set (e.g. table), to lay (foundation), to install, to seat (someone), to settle (upon something), to fix (e.g. one's gaze), to apply (moxa)
座る【すわる】to sit, to squat, to assume (a position), to hold steady, to hold still
